depiction.2: An ancient, 30-foot tall angel with featherless wings, imprisoned and "milked" for his blood by House Halovar in a machine called the Prismatic Retort. He is the grandfather of Wicander Halovar.
depiction.3: An ancient angel, servant of the dead sun god Tansul. Imprisoned by House Halovar, his 'blood' is the source of the Candescent Creed's Filament. He fathered Godard Halovar via a magic ritual performed by Yanessa Halovar, making him Wicander's grandfather.

2: Imprisoned within the Prismatic Retort by House Halovar
3: Servant of the dead sun god, Tansul

depiction.2: A clumsy demon with bright blue skin and spectacles, dressed in monkish robes. She is the sister of Tyranny, Enmity, and Cruelty, and serves House Halovar as an Aspirant.

3: Maker is Ksha'aravi, High Prince of Demonkind

depiction.1: The son of Halandil Fang and Thaisha Lloy, and brother to Shadia. He is not present at his uncle's execution or wake.
depiction.3: The son of Halandil Fang and Thaisha Lloy. A warrior who chose to "protect this world with his blade." His sister Shadia is worried for him.

depiction.2: Celestials who came into existence with the gods. After the gods' death in the Shapers' War, they went feral, becoming ravening monsters. To encounter one is now considered a death sentence.

3: Aetheon, a celestial servant of the sun god Tansul, is the source of the Candescent Creed's Filament.

depiction.1: The world in which Campaign 4 is set.
A human noblewoman of House Royce, in her forties. The grieving widow of Thjazi Fang and a childhood friend of Sir Julien Davinos.
depiction.4: A human noblewoman of House Royce, widow of Thjazi Fang. A childhood friend of Sir Julien Davinos, she possesses druidic magical abilities, including casting spells like Haste and Tree Stride to aid her allies.

1: Childhood friend of Sir Julien Davinos
3: Instructed Sir Julien Davinos to find Occtis Tachonis.

depiction.1: An ancient Shaper for whom a theater in Dol-Makjar, the Dithyramb of Azgra, is named.
depiction.3: An ancient, tyrannical Shaper god who was worshipped by the orcs of Dol-Makjar in a dithyramb later named for him. He was fought and presumably killed during the Shapers' War.

depiction.1: A proud human man, 5'10", with medium brown skin and coppery auburn hair. An Arcane Marshal of the Revolutionary Guard in Dol-Makjar, he wears full armor with his arms exposed, revealing a tattoo. Played by Luis Carazo.

1: Arcane Marshal of the Revolutionary Guard
2: Father passed him off to mercenaries as a child
3: Met with Lord Knight Einfasen of the Sundered Houses.

depiction.1: A figure who wears a gray, expressive clay mask with large, empty black eyes. He has long, curly, dark red hair and dresses in fine black leather and suede over deep crimson. He is a curator at a museum. Played by Taliesin Jaffe.
depiction.2: A figure who wears a gray, expressive clay mask. He has long, curly, dark red hair and dresses in fine black leather and suede. He is the curator of the Lloy Wing at The Archanade museum. Played by Taliesin Jaffe.
depiction.4: A sentient magical mask created during the Shapers' War to kill the goddess Rauwyn. It possesses host bodies, its current one being a former criminal named Aubrus Drime. Its true form is a gray clay mask with empty eyes. Played by Taliesin Jaffe.

2: Curator of the Lloy Wing at The Archanade
3: Acquainted with Olgud Akarat through The Archanade's Lyceum.
4: Blackmailed and forced to work for Thjazi Fang
Possesses the body of the criminal Aubrus Drime
Has unseen 'brothers and sisters' (other masks)

depiction.2: The headquarters of the Revolutionary Guard, located in the Rubble Cliff neighborhood. It is dedicated to the legacy of the Shapers' War.
A famous song from the early, hopeful days of the Falconer's Rebellion, played in taverns and military tents by the rebels.

2: Known by Hal and Hero Fang

depiction.1: A religious faction in Dol-Makjar associated with House Halovar. Led by the Photarch, the matriarch of House Halovar, they worship a divinity called "the Light."
depiction.3: A fraudulent religious faction created by Yanessa Halovar as a political and financial tool. They worship 'the Light' and use a substance called the Filament, which is secretly harvested from the imprisoned angel Aetheon.

3: Secretly allied with the demon prince Ksha'aravi

depiction.2: A lower neighborhood in Dol-Makjar that serves as a hub for merchant caravans. It is home to The Guard Tower tavern, a known Crow Keepers haunt.

depiction.1: An old member of the Torn Banner mercenary company who was supposed to provide a wagon for Thjazi Fang's escape.
depiction.2: An old member of the Torn Banner who was part of Thjazi Fang's failed escape plan. He is also a member of the Crow Keepers thieves' guild. A flashback shows him saving Thjazi during the Falconer's Rebellion.

2: Befriended Thjazi Fang in the Torn Banner
Saved Thjazi Fang during the Falconer's Rebellion
3: Previously worked at the Underwallen & Sisters wainwrights
Acquired a deed to a stronghouse in Gormalay

depiction.1: A governing body in Dol-Makjar composed of nobles from the Sundered Houses. It serves as an advisory council to the Revolutionary Council.

4: Lady Amariya Cormoray is one of its representatives

depiction.1: One of the oldest thieves' guilds in Dol-Makjar, suspected by Kattigan Vale of being involved in the attack on Thimble's hideout.
depiction.2: One of the oldest thieves' guilds in Dol-Makjar. They have a code of conduct and are known to frequent The Guard Tower tavern in Caravan Hill. They are suspected of attacking Thimble's hideout.

3: Led by a guildmaster named Solomon
Operate out of The Guard Tower tavern

depiction.2: A demon with ruby red lips, small silvery horns, and a whipping tail. She is the sister of Tyranny, Enmity, and Agony, and serves House Halovar as an Aspirant.

3: Maker is Ksha'aravi, High Prince of Demonkind

depiction.1: A sallow-faced arcanist with a leather vest, no shirt, and a ruffle tie. An associate of Thjazi Fang and Murray Mag'Nesson who deals in items such as skulls.

A city of gray stone at the eastern edge of Kahad, built along the River Vrosh. It is the seat of the Revolutionary Council and is known for its history of heroism, particularly from the Shapers' War.

2: Location of The Guard Tower tavern
4: Location of The Fray neighborhood
Location of the Potter's Field tavern
Location of the Lloy Estate

depiction.1: A settlement in the region of Kahad where the family of the orcish warrior Loza Blade resides.

depiction.2: A mountain pass where resupply carriages for House Davinos and House Royce were stopped.

4: Site of a confrontation between House Royce carriages and House Tachonis forces, according to a vision

depiction.2: An older, rotund human man who is the Captain of the Arcane Marshals, a division of the Revolutionary Guard.
A halfling professor and the Dean of the Penteveral. He is forced to resign his position by the Chamber of Lords-Advisory.

depiction.1: A beautiful human merchant woman in her early forties. She is Halandil Fang's former partner and the mother of their half-orc daughter, Hero.
A demon Aspirant of the Candescent Creed and sibling to Tyranny. Has deep, speckled red and black skin and ram-like curling horns.
depiction.2: A towering demon Aspirant of the Candescent Creed and sister to Tyranny, Cruelty, and Agony. She has deep, speckled red and black skin and ram-like curling horns.

3: Maker is Ksha'aravi, High Prince of Demonkind

depiction.3: The brother of Occtis Tachonis. Leading a squad of ghouls on behalf of House Tachonis, he ambushes Occtis at the Palazzo Davinos, wielding an artifact that appears to be the Stone of Nightsong.

4: Murderer of his brother, Occtis Tachonis

depiction.1: A past war or rebellion. Many notable figures fought in it, including Thjazi Fang, Azune Nayar, Teor Pridesire, Loza Blade, and Kattigan Vale.

3: The Falcon's Rest in Dol-Makjar is a monument to its fallen.

depiction.1: An orcish grieving custom in Kahad, essentially a wake held as soon as possible after a death, where the body is put on display for respects.

depiction.2: A glowing white liquid substance used by the Candescent Creed for rituals and magic. It is created by the Prismatic Retort and can be tattooed onto skin.
depiction.3: A glowing white liquid; the harvested celestial essence of the imprisoned angel Aetheon. Used by the Candescent Creed for rituals and magic, it can be diluted using an alchemical element from the D'Antonio vineyards.

depiction.2: A young gnomish grad student at the Penteveral who informs Murray Mag'Nesson of Dean Tallbarrel's resignation.

depiction.3: Undead creatures in the service of House Tachonis. A squad of six ghouls, led by Ethrand Tachonis, was sent to capture Occtis Tachonis at the Palazzo Davinos.
depiction.4: Undead creatures in the service of House Tachonis. A squad was sent to capture Occtis Tachonis, magically enhanced to be stronger and more resilient than normal ghouls.

3: In the service of House Tachonis

depiction.1: An enormous, powerful man with white hair, son of the Photarch of the Candescent Creed. He has a notable spinal curvature and wears a black blindfold. He is Wicander Halovar's father.
depiction.2: An enormous, powerful man with white hair, son of the Photarch of the Candescent Creed. His eyes are lidless and emit beams of light, which he usually keeps hidden behind a black blindfold. He is Wicander Halovar's father.
depiction.3: Son of Yanessa Halovar and the angel Aetheon, born via a magic ritual. An enormous man with white hair and light-emitting eyes, he also possesses stunted wings that can sprout luminous feathers. He is Wicander Halovar's father.

1: Son of the Photarch of the Candescent Creed

depiction.3: A settlement located in the northern region of Timmony. The rogue Casimir Gavendale acquired a deed to a stronghouse there, intending to flee there after betraying Thjazi Fang's group.

3: Location of a stronghouse owned by Casimir Gavendale

depiction.1: A massive wall at the eastern edge of Dol-Makjar, featuring 80-foot-tall statues of heroes from the Shapers' War carved into its masonry.
A deer that is the wild companion of the druid Thaisha Lloy. She can be summoned via Wild Shape and can continue performing rites in Thaisha's stead.
An older orc gentleman with dark hair streaked with white and kind smile lines. A bard and theater owner in Dol-Makjar, he is the brother of the executed Thjazi Fang. Played by Liam O'Brien.

1: Father of Shadia Fang, Hero Fang, and Alogar Fang
Owner of the Dithyramb of Azgra

depiction.1: A young half-orc woman, the daughter of Halandil Fang and the human merchant Elodie.
depiction.2: A young half-orc woman, daughter of Halandil Fang and the human merchant Elodie. She is a skilled lyre player who sometimes performs with her father.
One of the Sundered Houses of Aramán, known for its powerful sorcerers who fought for the established powers during the Falconer's Rebellion.

4: Lady Amariya Cormoray, a member of the Chamber of Lords-Advisory, belongs to this house

depiction.2: One of the five Sundered Houses that sits on the Chamber of Lords-Advisory. They are seeking to expand their power and influence in Dol-Makjar.

2: Member of the Chamber of Lords-Advisory

depiction.1: A stoic human man in his late 20s with long, curly black hair. A knight of the Vassal House Davinos, serving House Royce. He wears a distinctive metal gauntlet on his left hand. Played by Matthew Mercer.

1: Captured Thjazi Fang at Maharlian Falls
4: His aides Jahar, Ilondria, and Mardonus were killed by Primus Tachonis

depiction.1: A region of Aramán. The city of Dol-Makjar is located at its eastern edge. It also contains the settlements of Dol-Rungja and Pinebrough.
A human ranger and bounty hunter played by Robbie Daymond. An older, weathered man of 6'4" who lives a wild life with his wolf companion, Wulfric. Wears a cowl and hood.

depiction.2: A dwarven woman with platinum blonde hair. She is chosen by the Chamber of Lords-Advisory to replace Ellipides Tallbarrel as Dean of the Penteveral.

depiction.3: A scimitar forged by the Lloy family, formerly wielded by Thjazi Fang and now possessed by Halandil Fang. It has a distinctive maker's mark that looks like a smirking, half-masked face.

depiction.1: An ancient, broad-shouldered orcish warrior woman with graying hair and filigreed gold rings in her tusks. She is the former commander of the Torn Banner mercenary company and a follower of the Old Path.

1: Former Commander of the Torn Banner
2: Passed leadership of the Torn Banner to Teor Pridesire
Her family (the Blades) was looked after by the Lloy family

depiction.2: A neighborhood in the city of Kahad, located across the River Vrosh from Dol-Makjar. It is home to The Archanade museum.
An older gnomish woman who is the proprietor of The Tangled Sheet, a house of companionship in Dol-Makjar.

depiction.1: The location of a battle where Sir Julien Davinos became known as a hero for capturing Thjazi Fang.

1: Site of a battle involving Sir Julien Davinos and Thjazi Fang

depiction.2: The highest neighborhood of Dol-Makjar, located near the River Vrosh. It is the location of The Grey Tower.

depiction.1: A mountain range on the eastern edge of Kahad, held at bay by Dol-Makjar's Guardian Wall.
The homeland of Vaelus and the Sisters of Sylandri.

1: Home of the Sisters of Sylandri

depiction.1: A dwarf wizard with long auburn hair, a braided chin strap, and several front teeth replaced with gemstones. She favors colorful, sleeveless duster jackets and works at the Penteveral. Played by Marisha Ray.
depiction.2: A dwarf wizard with auburn hair, braided chin strap, and teeth replaced with gemstones. She favors colorful, sleeveless duster jackets and works as the Bursar at the Penteveral. Played by Marisha Ray.
depiction.4: A dwarf wizard of the Divination School and Bursar at the Penteveral. She has long auburn hair, a braided chin strap, and teeth replaced with gemstones. Played by Marisha Ray.

3: Had Solomon of the Crow Keepers as an underworld contact.
4: Resurrected Occtis Tachonis in collaboration with Bolaire

depiction.2: A dwarven woman and medic who served with the Torn Banner during the Falconer's Rebellion. She has a thick, braided beard and an empty upper lip.

depiction.1: A young, thin human man (5'11") from House Tachonis, with dark hair, olive skin, and green eyes. An academic necromancer with a constructed fox familiar named Pincushion. Played by Alexander Ward.
depiction.2: A young human necromancer from House Tachonis with a constructed fox familiar. He is the son of Lord Primus Tachonis but is being hunted by his own family for his involvement in Thjazi's escape plot. Played by Alexander Ward.
depiction.4: A young human necromancer from House Tachonis. After being murdered by his brother Ethrand, he was resurrected into an undead state via the Stone of Nightsong, no longer possessing a heart or needing to breathe. Played by Alexander Ward.

2: Sent to Venatus with Thaisha Lloy to retrieve an artifact for Thjazi Fang
4: Murdered by his brother, Ethrand Tachonis
Resurrected by Bolaire Lathalia and Murray Mag'Nesson

depiction.2: A celestial who served as the halfling Angel of Death, a psychopomp known as the Sister of Mists who guided souls to their final rest before the Shapers' War.

2: The Coffin of Olbalad is named after her

depiction.1: An ancient, likely Orcish, belief system with druidic elements focused on the natural cycle of life and death.
An older orcish gentleman with silver at his temples. He is a theater producer and Halandil Fang's business partner.

3: Works with Halandil Fang at The Hallowed Round.

depiction.2: The estate and residence of House Davinos within Dol-Makjar.
depiction.3: The estate of House Davinos in Dol-Makjar. It features gardens with trees from Faerie and abuts the River Vrosh.

3: Site of General Raimond Davinos's assassination
4: Assaulted by Primus Tachonis, who assassinated General Raimond Davinos and killed numerous staff with a Circle of Death ritual

depiction.4: Magical weapons crafted by the orcish smiths of the Lloy family to defeat the Shaper gods, most notably Azgra the Conqueror. The surviving blades are now on display in The Archanade museum.

1: Part of the history of the city of Dol-Makjar
2: Crafted by the orcish smiths of the Lloy family to defeat Azgra the Conqueror
4: The exhibit is being reviewed by Lady Amariya Cormoray

1: Teor Pridesire has worked as a mercenary there

depiction.1: An institution of an academic or arcane nature. Occtis Tachonis studied there, and Murray Mag'Nesson works there.

1: Place of study for Occtis Tachonis
Place of work for Murray Mag'Nesson
3: Dean Tallbarrel is resigning his position
Dean Kora is the incoming Dean

depiction.1: A small, mostly white fox familiar constructed from the parts of different foxes. It has purple button eyes and is the companion of Occtis Tachonis.
depiction.2: A small constructed fox familiar made from parts of different arctic and red foxes. It has purple button eyes, a purple scarf, and is the companion of Occtis Tachonis.
depiction.3: A small constructed fox familiar made from parts of different foxes. It has purple button eyes and a purple scarf. It is an undead spirit and is the companion of Occtis Tachonis.
depiction.4: A small constructed fox familiar made from parts of different foxes. An undead spirit, he is the companion of Occtis Tachonis. He was destroyed upon Occtis's death and reborn from his master's body upon his resurrection.

depiction.1: A small agricultural and crafting community located in the region of Kahad. Mentioned by Kattigan Vale.

depiction.2: The head of House Tachonis and father of Occtis. A tall, grave figure with sallow skin, described as a dangerous political mover who is actively searching for his son.
depiction.4: The head of House Tachonis and a powerful necromancer. He murdered General Raimond Davinos and led the assault on the Palazzo Davinos, summoning shadows and casting Circle of Death before escaping via Plane Shift.

3: Resides at Obrimus Manor while in Dol-Makjar
4: Murderer of General Raimond Davinos

depiction.2: A machine in the Villa Aurora used by House Halovar to distill Filament from a captive angel. It appears as a 40-foot-tall sarcophagus or iron maiden.

2: Contains the grandfather of Wicander Halovar
Used by House Halovar to create Filament

depiction.2: Father of Sir Julien Davinos and a General of House Davinos. A scarred veteran of the War of Axe and Vine with a silvering mustache and goatee.
depiction.3: Father of Sir Julien Davinos and a General. A scarred veteran of the War of Axe and Vine, he was assassinated in his home, the Palazzo Davinos, by an agent of House Tachonis.

2: Served with Thjazi Fang during the War of Axe and Vine
4: Murdered by Primus Tachonis

depiction.2: An ancient halfling goddess known as the Trickster, to whom temples were dedicated.

4: The intended assassination target of the sentient mask, Bolaire

depiction.1: The primary governing body of Dol-Makjar, advised by the Chamber of Lords-Advisory.

3: Employs Cyd Pridesire as a wagon driver.

depiction.1: A military and law-enforcement body serving the Revolutionary Council in Dol-Makjar.
A river that flows step-by-step down from the mountains through the city of Dol-Makjar.
depiction.3: A river flowing through Dol-Makjar from the mountains to Lake Nahami.

depiction.2: A neighborhood in Dol-Makjar where The Tangled Sheet is located. It borders the Embers and the Penteveral.
A neighborhood in Kahad, home to the Brethren Hall, the headquarters of the Revolutionary Guard.
The central tenets of the Candescent Creed, a religious doctrine followed by House Halovar. They include principles such as forgiveness.

depiction.1: A young orcish woman, daughter of Halandil Fang and Thaisha Lloy. She wears harlequin-patterned breeches and studies to be a performer like her father.
depiction.2: A 25-year-old half-orc woman, daughter of Halandil Fang and Thaisha Lloy. She wears harlequin-patterned breeches and studies to be a performer like her father.

4: Proposed painting murals of legendary figures like Bolan D'Varstrey and Lugzub Kettlehelm in The Hallowed Round
Shades

depiction.1: A shadowy entity of unknown origin, born from a desecrated Orcish funereal rite. It was seen by Bolaire Lathalia following Sir Julien Davinos from Thjazi Fang's wake.
depiction.4: Incorporeal undead summoned by Primus Tachonis at the Palazzo Davinos. They drain the life and strength from their victims and are vulnerable to radiant damage.

4: Summoned by Primus Tachonis

depiction.1: A historic revolution whose heroes are immortalized in the Guardian Wall of Dol-Makjar. It involved the destruction of a celestial being, leading to the creation of the Stone of Nightsong.
Ancient, powerful beings who shaped the world and its peoples, such as the goddess Sylandri who shaped the elves, and Azgra. They were fought in the Shapers' War.
depiction.3: Ancient beings who shaped the world. The orcish Shaper, Azgra, was a god of war who demanded conquest and was killed in a revolution by his people, aided by the Lloy family.
depiction.4: Ancient god-like beings who shaped the world's peoples. Notable Shapers include Azgra (Orcs), Rauwyn (Halflings), an unnamed sun god (Humans), and Sylandri (Elves). Mortals created special weapons to kill them in the Shapers' War.

3: Azgra was the Shaper of the Orcs.
4: Rauwyn was the Shaper of the Halflings
An unnamed Sun God was the Shaper of the Humans

depiction.2: The uncle of Wicander Halovar and the head of security for House Halovar and the Candescent Creed.
depiction.3: Uncle of Wicander Halovar and head of security for House Halovar. A gray-bearded knight with luminous tattoos around his neck and eyes. He is accompanied by two magically-attuned dogs, Wrath and Judgment.

2: Head of Security for House Halovar
3: Master of the dogs Wrath and Judgment

depiction.2: A Lord Knight of House Einfasen and a member of the Chamber of Lords-Advisory. He seeks to increase the influence of the Sundered Houses over Dol-Makjar's security.

2: Member of the Chamber of Lords-Advisory

depiction.1: A religious order of elves who worship Sylandri, the Fallen Goddess of Life. Vaelus is a member. They are based in the Mournvale.

depiction.3: The name given to the adventuring party who fled Dol-Makjar together, consisting of Teor Pridesire, Wicander Halovar, Tyranny, Thimble, and Kattigan Vale.

depiction.2: An older, high-ranking member of the Crow Keepers thieves' guild, identifiable by his black felt hat and long coat. He operates out of The Guard Tower tavern.
depiction.3: A guildmaster of the Crow Keepers who operated out of The Guard Tower. He was killed by Vaelus during a confrontation.

depiction.1: A black stone carved to look like a nightingale embracing itself. An elven artifact from the Shapers' War, it was created to safely ferry elven souls through the Tenebral Reaches, the underworld, to their afterlife.

1: Created by a celestial servant of Sylandri
Stolen by Thjazi Fang and Thimble
Sought by Vaelus of the Sisters of Sylandri
4: Placed inside the corpse of Occtis Tachonis by his brother Ethrand
Used to restore Occtis Tachonis to a state of unlife

depiction.1: A powerful faction of noble houses in Dol-Makjar, including House Tachonis, House Halovar, and House Royce. They exercise significant authority through their Chamber of Lords-Advisory.

1: Their Chamber of Lords-Advisory sentenced Thjazi Fang to death
Includes House Tachonis, House Halovar, House Royce, House Einfasen, and House Cormoray
Her celestial servant created the Stone of Nightsong
Worshipped by the Sisters of Sylandri
2: The Wastes are the site of her death
Vaelus is a member of her order, the Sisters of Sylandri

depiction.3: Younger brother of Teor Pridesire. After being betrayed by Casimir in Thjazi's failed rescue, he stole a deed from Casimir and is now being pursued by him.

1: Was supposed to drive the getaway wagon in the failed rescue of Thjazi Fang
3: Betrayed by Casimir of the Crow Keepers.

depiction.2: The ancient god of the sun, once worshipped by the Obridimian empire but now considered a false god by factions like the Candescent Creed.

3: The celestial Aetheon was one of his servants.

1: The Stone of Nightsong was created to bypass this realm for elven souls
4: Site of a war being waged by the forces of House Tachonis

depiction.1: A very tall, powerfully-built lion man (nama) with dark silver fur and a long mane. As a Vanguard Marshal, he wears a golden breastplate and purple vestments. Portrayed by Travis Willingham.

1: Served with Thjazi Fang in the Falconer's Rebellion
Served with Azune Nayar in the Falconer's Rebellion
Companion to Loza Blade, former Commander of the Torn Banner
2: Became the new leader of the Torn Banner
Hired as a bodyguard for Wicander Halovar
3: Pledged a life debt to Wicander Halovar.

depiction.1: A tall orc druid with desaturated green skin and long, dark, graying hair. Her eyes have black scleras and silver irises ringed in red. She is from the prominent Lloy family. Portrayed by Aabria Iyengar.
depiction.2: A tall orc druid of the prominent Lloy family and a member of the Circle of Ancients. She has dark, graying hair and eyes with black scleras and silver irises. Portrayed by Aabria Iyengar.

1: Mother of Shadia and Alogar Fang
Part of the failed plot to rescue Thjazi Fang
2: Member of the Circle of Ancients
Sent to Venatus with Occtis Tachonis to retrieve an artifact for Thjazi Fang
4: Her family's ancestral estate is in the Mirzash neighborhood
Her family, the Lloys, forged the Pariah Blades during the Shapers' War

depiction.2: A massive museum in the Lugzash neighborhood of Kahad. It contains multiple wings, including the Lloy Wing, and is situated by the River Vrosh.

2: Bolaire Lathalia is the curator of its Lloy Wing
4: Contains a secret vault storing powerful artifacts, including the fossilized hand of a primordial giant

depiction.1: A dive bar in Dol-Makjar that Murray Mag'Nesson uses as a meeting spot on certain days.

depiction.2: The hall of the Revolutionary Council, located in the Marud neighborhood of Dol-Makjar. It is considered the center of power in the city.

3: Site of the Falcon's Rest stables

depiction.2: A tavern located in the Caravan Hill neighborhood of Dol-Makjar. It is a known meeting place and base of operations for the Crow Keepers thieves' guild.
depiction.3: A tavern in Caravan Hill that serves as the home base of the Crow Keepers thieves' guild.

2: A frequent haunt of the Crow Keepers
3: Site of the killing of guildmaster Solomon

depiction.1: An ancient and seemingly forbidden public space in Dol-Makjar, deeded to Halandil Fang by the Revolutionary Council to be used as a theater.
depiction.3: An ancient amphitheater, formerly a site for rituals to the Shaper Azgra, now being converted into "The Hallowed Round" theater by Halandil Fang. A massive, gnarled cedar tree stands at its center, overlooking the Tintazy Wood.

4: Shadia Fang proposed decorating its walls with murals of legendary figures

depiction.3: The fiendish home realm of Tyranny and her sisters, ruled by Ksha'aravi, the High Prince of Demonkind.

2: The realm from which Tyranny and her demon sisters originate
3: Home of the demon prince Ksha'aravi.

depiction.1: A neighborhood in Dol-Makjar known for its many towers, sky bridges, aviaries, and community of poets and performers. It is Halandil Fang's home.

depiction.2: A house of companionship in the Rozigar neighborhood of Dol-Makjar, run by Madam Gurlistra and frequented by Sir Julien Davinos.

2: The wood for the Coffin of Olbalad was sourced from here

depiction.1: A small, four-inch-tall pixie with short brown hair and spring green wings, appearing to be around 18 years old. She wields two needle-like swords. Portrayed by Laura Bailey.
depiction.2: A small pixie with short brown hair and spring green wings. She was originally a 'wedding gift' from Aranessa Royce to Thjazi Fang, but became his equal partner. Wields two needle-like swords. Portrayed by Laura Bailey.

1: Attacked by the Crow Keepers in Thjazi's hideout
Was responsible for the teleportation glyph in Thjazi's failed escape
2: Was a wedding gift to Thjazi Fang from Aranessa Royce
4: Acted as a go-between for Thjazi Fang and the artifact collector Bolaire Lathalia

depiction.1: A handsome orc, brother to Halandil Fang. Known as a traitor and arcanist by the state but a hero to many, including veterans of the Falconer's Rebellion. He was executed at the start of the campaign.

1: Commander to Azune Nayar in the Falconer's Rebellion
Served under Loza Blade in the Torn Banner
2: Tasked Thaisha and Occtis with retrieving an artifact from Venatus
4: Blackmailed the ancient being Bolaire Lathalia into stealing items for him
Had a working relationship with bursar Murray Mag'Nesson

depiction.3: A northern region containing the settlement of Gormalay. Kattigan Vale reports that the wilderness there is dangerous.

2: Fought against the Sundered Houses during the Falconer's Rebellion
Loza Blade passed on the tattered banner of the company to Teor Pridesire

depiction.1: A brawny, boar-headed beastfolk warrior and a member of the old Torn Banner mercenary company, acquainted with Loza Blade.
A demon with bubblegum-pink skin, white hair, yellow goat's eyes, ears, horns, and hooves. An Aspirant to the Candescent Creed, she serves as the ward of Wicander Halovar. Portrayed by Whitney Moore.

3: Her creator is Ksha'aravi, the High Prince of Demonkind.

1: Its doors have closed to the mortal world
3: Seeds from Tír Cruthú grow in the gardens of the Palazzo Davinos.

depiction.1: A tall elven woman with arcane scars on her face, hidden by a black hood and a chainmail veil. A cleric of the fallen goddess Sylandri, she wields a censer on a long chain. Portrayed by Ashley Johnson.

1: Member of the Sisters of Sylandri
Follower of the fallen goddess Sylandri
Traveled from the Mournvale seeking the Stone of Nightsong

depiction.2: A location where Thaisha Lloy and Occtis Tachonis were sent by Thjazi Fang to retrieve a mysterious halfling-sized coffin.

depiction.1: The estate of the House of Halovar located in the city of Dol-Makjar.
depiction.2: The estate of House Halovar and home of the Candescent Creed in the Mirzash ward of Dol-Makjar. It is a palatial building of white stone with a central tower topped with prismatic glass.
Enormous hounds with bioluminescent drool and golden plates over their eyes. They serve as guardians for House Halovar and can innately cast Dispel Magic.

2: Used as guardians by House Halovar in the Villa Aurora

1: Halandil Fang and Thjazi Fang were veterans
2: Thjazi Fang saved Raimond Davinos's cousin's life during this war

depiction.1: A beautiful human man in his late 20s with light teal and white hair. A Light Priest of the Candescent Creed, he wears matching robes and has pearlescent, shimmering tattoos on his face. Portrayed by Sam Riegel.
depiction.2: A beautiful human man, a Light Priest of the Candescent Creed. He is the grandson of Photarch Yanessa Halovar and son of Godard Halovar. His grandfather is a celestial being imprisoned by his family to harvest its power. Portrayed by Sam Riegel.
depiction.3: A human Light Priest from House Halovar. Son of Godard and Iris, brother to Zebani. His power stems from his celestial bloodline, inherited from his grandfather, the imprisoned angel Aetheon. Portrayed by Sam Riegel.

1: Guardian to the demon Aspirant, Tyranny
Had dealings with Halandil Fang regarding his theater
2: Grandson of an imprisoned celestial being

depiction.1: A massive juvenile wolf, the animal companion of Kattigan Vale. He wears armor that mirrors Kattigan's, including a tattered cowl.
depiction.2: A massive juvenile wolf, the animal companion of Kattigan Vale. He wears armor that mirrors Kattigan's and has a magical prosthetic for one of his front paws.

The Photarch of the Candescent Creed and ruthless matriarch of House Halovar. She holds the family's darkest secrets, including the imprisonment of her husband, the angel Aetheon, as the source of their power.
depiction.3: Photarch of the Candescent Creed and matriarch of House Halovar. She imprisoned the angel Aetheon and used his celestial essence to magically conceive her son, Godard, and create the Filament, the source of her family's power.

depiction.2: The dwarven neighborhood in Dol-Makjar, built into the side of the Kavrosi Mountains. It borders the Penteveral.

3: Location of the Underwallen & Sisters wainwrights
